keyword: how many calories is in a peanut butter sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a peanut butter sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter, no jelly, butter, or additions; untoasted.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, portion size, and additions like jelly. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard peanut butter sandwich has about 350 kcal, with 13 g protein and 18 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories is in a peanut butter sandwich without jelly?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a basic version with 2 slices bread and 2 tbsp peanut butter.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 35 g carbs, 13 g protein, 18 g fat, and 4 g fiber per sandwich.

faqs.q: Does adding jelly change calories in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp jelly adds about 50 kcal, making it around 400 kcal total.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a peanut butter sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 13 g, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is a peanut butter sandwich high in sodium?
faqs.a: It can be around 400 mg due to salted peanut butter and bread; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce.
